Commentary.ab: Y14.1a aibī.jarətā] sec. cod.; Geldner, Kellens aibijarətā.

Y14 is built differently in the ceremonies of the Long Liturgy. It is a modified repetition of the Barsom Yašt (Y2). Y14 and YR14 are composed by two introductory stanzas in MAv. (Y14.1, Y14.2) + the mention of vīspa yazata and vīspa ratu (this last absent in YR). In Visperad, Vidēvdād and Vištāsp Yašt, the first stanza (VrS14.1) appears in YAv. and they add in VrS14.1b the mention of ratufriti-, vərəϑraγniia- and huruniia-. Besides, a third introductory stanza to the repetition of the Barsom Yašt is added. In Visperad, Vištāsp Yašt and the Indian Vidēvdād this version of Barsom Yašt consists on the mention of the barsom (VrS14.4), of Ahura Mazdā and the Aməṣ̌a Spəṇta (VrS14.5) and, in the case of the Vištāsp Yašt, the ceremonial ratu (VytVrS14.6), that is absent in the Indian Vidēvdād; of the vīspa ratu (VrS14.6), of the Frauuaṣ̌iš (VrS14.7) and again the vīspa yazata and vīspa ratu (VrS14.8). The Iranian Vidēvdād, however, attest the Barsom Yašt with the mention of all the ratu. However, after the mention of the ceremonial ratu (VVrS14.6), it is followed by the categorical mention of the ratu asńiia, māhiia, yāiriia and sarəδa (VVrS14.7), as in the Srōš Drōn (vid. Martínez Porro, 2022).
